title: Len Saldua
author: Len Saldua
content: How important is trading volume when trying to decide whether to invest in a new project ? The higher the better ? But if people are "selling off" like crazy wouldn't that also mean a high trading volume ?

comments.author: ryzaadit
comments.body: You should be compared to the order books.Some exchanges are doing wash trading, by make a bot transaction to increase the volume of trading coin/token in their exchange. If you see a token with high volume but a soft order book: 90% of them is a wash trading. Why volume & order book is important, because with high volume and a strong orderbook you are easily to sell off your larger asset.Doesn't matter, If there has some larger sell as long the order book is strong is good. Anyone dump by single person is also good, because you can spread the token to more people.

comments.author: Len Saldua
comments.body: Whoa ! Several low cap Altcoins are now at zero trading volume !! Even some of the good ones !Okay so lets explore this.... if trading volume is at zero... does that mean that any purchase would make the price go up ? ( in theory ) So then would it be possible to push that price upwards by making a not so small purchase ? ( like $1000 or $2000 ) If this is true, then you could in theory manipulate that market in your favour, and get possibly a 2X or a 3X out of it, if trading volume is zero. I'm talking about very very small low caps though, which are already 0.00 something at least.In case you think this is impossible... I saw it happen with one particular Altcoin in the top 1000. The price was so low a few days ago, I think it hit negative 99.8 per cent or something, that one large purchase made it go up 950% in one day !! Only in crypto !!

comments.author: Ulven
comments.body: One of the most important things for traders is to keep track of the trading volume. It gives them an idea of how much activity is happening at any given time and in what direction. Trading volume comes with a couple of advantages and disadvantages, so it shouldn't be approached without understanding all the possible outcomes.onthe other hand, trading volume can be faked. To avoid being deceived by fake volumes, you need to understand the order book which is a list of low sell and buy prices

comments.author: crwth
comments.body: Trading volume is the amount and number of assets traded, whether crypto or fiat. Where a transaction happened, and the factors of it areQuantityPrice soldThis won't correlate with how much a project could be worth because you can quickly inflate the trading volume by hiring the right people. I know there are some services you could do, and some algo trading bots would also be suitable for that. That wouldn't be a definite signal for you. It might be hard to do if you were to follow that type of indicator.

comments.author: The Cryptovator
comments.body: Trading volume is a fact when you are choosing an altcoin for trading. But it doesn't indicate you should be involved with the trade. If there is no trading volume that means no one buying or selling, it's a kind of dead token. If the trading volume is high due to selling pressure like what happened to Luna, then it's highly risky. If the candle is green and trading volume is high that means you might consider trading. But it doesn't mean you can make a profit, the price would dump at any time. It's crypto and always risky.

comments.author: Xal0lex
comments.body: Trade volume is often inflated, so do not focus on it much. Don't forget that trading volume, which is shown on trading platforms, is not always the transactions of real people, bots are also involved. Obviously, this can be one of the metrics when choosing a project or deciding to buy/sell it. If you are concerned about trading volume formed on large-scale selloffs, it is also worth paying attention to the order book and looking at the depth of the market. If there are only sellers in the market, and the demand from buyers is very minimal, then clearly this project at the moment is not of interest in terms of investment.

comments.author: MAAManda
comments.body: Quote from: Len Saldua on June 14, 2022, 01:02:37 PMHow important is trading volume when trying to decide whether to invest in a new project ? The higher the better ? But if people are "selling off" like crazy wouldn't that also mean a high trading volume ?Trading volume is very important to see how enthusiastically people are trading on the token, but that doesn't mean a high trading volume indicates the project is a good one for you to invest in. As @ryzaadit already said, if you see a high trading volume, you should compare it to the order book, if you see a strong order book, it means that people are very enthusiastic about trading the token.

But if people are "selling off" like crazy wouldn't that also mean a high trading volume ?Trading volume is not a 100% verifiable metric. Because the trading volume of many coins and tokens is done with washtrade. This means that we cannot make a 100% accurate measurement. That's why investing and trading in major coins is always more secure. Also an important information; If a coin is experiencing a price drop while at low volume, it is a sign of bullish divergence.

comments.author: Lubcub62
comments.body: Trading volume is very important in trading. especially for a day trader. because of the high demand for buying and selling can facilitate or speed up the execution of a request for sale/purchase. In contrast to the low volume, it will be very difficult when we want to immediately execute a buy/sell request.However, when talking about long-term investment, it will be more profitable if we enter a coin or asset whose trading volume is still low, which means that the market cap is usually still low. so the potential increase is still visible. especially if it is seen that the trading volume is increasing, it can be ascertained that there will be an increase that follows also the price (on a note that the asset or coin has good potential with clear fundamentals and utilities).
